messageBody:
Ray V wrote:

> I'm in the initial stages of building a testing
> framework for a series of websites and I'm wondering
> how to build a webapp that runs my Junit tests.

Interesting. I wonder why you'd feel you had to build a test framework
for web sites, when so many good ones already exist.

> Currently I'm using JUnit and HttpUnit to create a
> series of functional tests for each site. The tests
> are run from the commandline using ant. This works
> great and I want to build on top of this.
>
> What I'd like to have is a web application that shows
> all the available tests, has checkboxes for each test
> to run. A submit button would run the chosen tests and
> show the test output in some way.

Oh! You want to build a custom test runner! That's completely different.

> Do I have to create my own test runner class for this?
> As I say I'm in the initial stages of research. I'd
> appreciate any advice. Thanks.

I would search the web. The odds are good that a servlet-based test
runner already exists.
--
J. B. (Joe) Rainsberger
Diaspar Software Services
http://www.diasparsoftware.com
Author, JUnit Recipes: Practical Methods for Programmer Testing
